required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High Intensity Laser Versus Plus Exercises
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of High Intensity Laser Therapy Plus Therapeutic Interventions in Treatment of Girls Gymnasts With Non-specific Wrist Pain

brief_summary.textblock: High-intensity laser therapy (HILT) has been used more recently in the therapeutic protocols of musculoskeletal pain management. This study is conducted to find out the effect of high intensity laser therapy only versus high intensity laser pulse exercises on level of wrist pain, function and Joint position sense in girls Gymnasts

detailed_description.textblock: Effect of high intensity laser plus exercises on wrist pain ..three groups of gymnastics girls suffer from non specific wrist is allocating ..the first group will receive exercises only , the second will receive laser only while the third will receive exercises plus laser

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre and post 4 weeks of intervention, decrease score indicate improvement
primary_outcome.description: The PRWE is a 15-item questionnaire that is used to rate wrist outcomes based on patient pain and function and is based on an 11-point (0-10) scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre and post 4 weeks of intervention, decrease score indicate improvement
secondary_outcome.description: JPS assesses precision or accuracy in repositioning a joint at a predetermined target angle

clinical_study.condition: Effect of High Intensity Laser Plus Exercises on Wrist Pain

arm_group.description: High Intensity Laser Therapy only , this group will receive laser for 4 weeks three times /week
Exercise , selected physiotherapy exercises will receive for 4 weeks ,3times/week
High intensity laser plus exercise will receive the selected exercises and laser 4 weeks, 3 times/week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All girls diagnosed with generalized chronic wrist pain and referred by orthopaedic physician.
- Their age between 10-16 years old
- They will be able to follow instructions.
- All are medically stable
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Bone fractures and tumors.
- Cases after plastic surgery.
- Hypertension (due to secondary vasoconstriction)
- Diabetes mellitus
- Pacemakers

responsible_party.investigator_title: lecturer in the deparment of pediatrics and peditaric surgery , faculty of phyical therapy
